steps.title: A question mark in a box means someone sent you an emoji your device doesnâ€™t support.
steps.content: A question mark in a box means someone sent you an emoji your device doesnâ€™t support. When new emojis get created, you typically have to update your device to be able to see them. So while the question mark in a box might look like an emoji, itâ€™s actually a placeholder or error that means that your deviceâ€™s general software is out-of-date. Depending on your device, the symbol might show up as â€‹â€‹ï¿½ (replacement character) or it might show up as a square symbol without the tilt. Solution: Fortunately, thereâ€™s an easy fix on iPhone or Android . Simply update your device to the latest software, and youâ€™ll be able to see the emojis normally again. [2] X Research source

steps.title: The â“ emoji usually symbolizes intense curiosity.
steps.content: The â“ emoji usually symbolizes intense curiosity. The bright red punctuation is like a regular question mark, taken up a notch in emotional intensity. You can use one â“ to represent your thirst for knowledge or add multiple question marks in a row for emphasis. â€œWhat did he say about dinosaurs â“â€ â€œOMG how did the episode end â“â“â€

steps.title: The â“ emoji can also signal a need for help.
steps.content: The â“ emoji can also signal a need for help. The emojiâ€™s red color emphasizes confusion and/or urgency. If you have a burning question, send a red question mark, and you might get a quicker response. â€œWe might have a problem. steps.title: The â” (white question mark) emoji signifies curiosity, doubt, or mystery.
steps.content: The â” (white question mark) emoji signifies curiosity, doubt, or mystery. Like the red question mark emoji, the white question mark serves as an emphasized form of regular punctuation. [4] X Research source You can use the two interchangeably.
